BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JUNIOR ACHIEVEMENT OF RHODE ISLAND INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ON BUSINESS ECONOMICS TO STUDENTS FROM KINDERGARTEN THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL THROUGH DIRECT CONTACT WITH THE BUSINESS COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ON BUSINESS ECONOMICS TO STUDENTS FROM KINDERGARTEN THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL THROUGH DIRECT CONTACT WITH THE BUSINESS COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ON BUSINESS ECONOMICS TO STUDENTS FROM KINDERGARTEN THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL THROUGH DIRECT CONTACT WITH THE BUSINESS COMMUNITY. DURING FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023, 22 PROGRAMS WERE GIVEN SERVING 10,516 STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES AS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS NOT CONSIDERED A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATES ITS UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS USING GUIDANCE FOR CONTINGENCIES AS CONTAINED IN U.S. GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES. THE ORGANIZATION WAS NOT AWARE OF ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WERE NOT PROVIDED FOR IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION ANNUALLY FILES INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FORM 990 - RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX, REPORTING VARIOUS INFORMATION THAT THE IRS USES TO MONITOR THE ACTIVITIES OF TAX-EXEMPT ENTITIES. THE TAX RETURN IS SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER FILING. THE ORGANIZATION CURRENTLY HAS NO TAX EXAMINATIONS IN PROGRESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS ELECT THE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY (BOARD OF DIRECTORS).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT THE ANNUAL MEETING, THE MEMBERS ELECT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION. DURING THE YEAR, IN AN AS NEEDED BASIS, THE MEMBERS CAN ELECT OTHER MEMBERS TO THE BOARD OF THE DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS HAVE THE RIGHT TO REMOVE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO REVIEW WAS OR WILL BE CONDUCTED BY THE BOARD. THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT THE ANNUAL MEETING, EVERY BOARD MEMBER AND EMPLOYEE IS ASKED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF A BOARD MEMBER HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST THE MEMBER IS NOT ALLOWED TO VOTE ON A MATTER THAT COULD BE AFFECTED BECAUSE OF THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: JUNIOR ACHIEVEMENT OF RHODE ISLAND USES THE CAREER AND COMPENSATION FRAMEWORK DESIGNED BY WILLIS TOWERS WATSON. THIS IS A MARKET-BASED APPROACH THAT IS ANCHORED IN MARKET COMPETITIVENESS AND CLOSELY CORRELATED WITH OUR ORGANIZATION'S SIZE AND GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

CURRICULUM MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 31,157. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 31,157. PROGRAM MARKETING: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 25,211. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 25,211. STUDENT AND VOLUNTEER MEALS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 20,367. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 20,367. EQUIPMENT EXPENSES AND SOFTWARE: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 7,075. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 769. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 541. TOTAL EXPENSES 8,385. FACILITIES AND OPERATING COSTS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 2,197. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 238. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 168. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,603.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
